abstract: Consumers spent $60 million in the second quarter to use navigation features built into their cellphones. Google could offer this feature free.
snippet: Consumers spent $60 million in the second quarter to use navigation features built into their cellphones. Google could offer this feature free.
lead_paragraph: Google has a penchant for taking services that had been paid and offering them free, often supported by advertising. So as the company moves to enter the cellphone software business, there is a natural question of whether it will be able to subsidize the cost of wireless service.

headline.main: One Reason We Need a Google Phone: Free GPS
